subject: Re: [junit] Re: Using System.out.println("something") ???
msgSnippet: ... Programmer Tests should be so simple that no logging is required. For bigger tests, add logging as you find you need it. I don t think there s any magic
messageBody:
>So said javainsel on 2003-05-12 --------------------
>> - you would like to have a println in your production code, use a
>logger (log4J,
>> commons-logging) instead
>>
>> -Vladimir
>
>What would you log?
>
>Or what is recommended to log?
>
>We want to use logging but we have no idea what we should log in
>JUnit tests.

Programmer Tests should be so simple that no logging is required.

For bigger tests, add logging as you find you need it. I don't think there's any magic formula as to when to use it and when not to use it.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
